intro: Pinalia microchila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pinalia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the cooler months. Pinalia microchila is adapted to survive in low-water conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
